query: What is the result of the ultrasound test?

results.text: Index Terms -Computer Vision, Fetal Gender, Ultrasounds

metadata.context: The chunk presents the index terms associated with the document, highlighting the key topics of "Computer Vision," "Fetal Gender," and "Ultrasounds," which are central to the research focus on using computer vision techniques for classifying fetal gender from ultrasound images. This context aids in categorizing and improving the retrieval of the document within academic and research databases.
metadata.title: A. Collection

results.text: Like was described in the previous alternative data section, the majority of our architecture exploration was first performed on tumor data, and then transferred to fetal data once data collection was complete. As such, we will report classification accuracies for both datasets, to give insight into the methods of model choice. A note here -we decided that given our application, accuracy would be our most applicable evaluation metric. We toyed with the idea of using precision, recall, and F1, but in determining fetal gender, accuracy would provide us with the most effective measure of success (As there is no reason to minimize type 1 or type 2 error).

metadata.context: This chunk discusses the methodology for evaluating classification models in the study, specifically focusing on the transition from tumor data to fetal data and justifying the choice of accuracy as the primary evaluation metric for predicting fetal gender, as opposed to other metrics like precision or recall.
metadata.title: VI. CLASSIFICATION

results.text: As there is a high penalty for HIPAA violations and many healthcare providers follow the prevailing paradigm of delaying the implementation of new technologies until rigorous testing is performed, or until mandated to do so by governing bodies, very little research has been done with regards to this topic, and some of the research, like that performed by a team at Fellowship.AI, had to be done on publicly available data rather than on information provided by healthcare professionals [4]. This paper builds on the techniques for data collection used in their paper, applied to a better curated dataset provided by a local healthcare provider, to achieve a different application.

metadata.context: This chunk discusses the challenges in conducting research on ultrasound data due to HIPAA regulations and the cautious approach of healthcare providers toward new technologies. It highlights the limited existing research on the topic and references a previous study by Fellowship.AI, setting the stage for the current paper's focus on utilizing a well-curated dataset from a local healthcare provider for improving fetal gender classification through computer vision techniques.
metadata.title: II. PREVIOUS WORK
